cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, paralleling the U.S. East Coast and heading toward Atlantic Canada
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Nova Scotia, Canada (as a post-tropical system)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Nova Scotia; Tropical Storm Watch from Prince Edward Island to parts of New Brunswick and Newfoundland
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Surf City NC to NC/VA border; Tropical Storm Warning North Carolina/Virginia border northward to Fenwick Island DE and portions of Chesapeake & coastal New England
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North Carolina Outer Banks northward through the Mid-Atlantic and New England coast, then Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Only brief, minimal tropical-storm-force gusts (<34 kt) possible as Dorian stays well offshore; prevailing winds mainly 15–25 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected; winds are offshore and cyclone is already northeast of Georgia.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light coastal showers possible; heavy rainfall confined north of Georgia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the Georgia coastline for the next 12–24 hours.
